decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 3 - Notwthstanding plans hereby approved, the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building. The external brickwork of the existing house shall remain unpainted.
REASON: To safeguard the appearance of the locality and maintain a coherent street scene.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s) / door(s), other than those shown on approved plan noï¿½s TAK-058-PR-PL-052 and TAK-058-PR-061 shall be installed in the north or south facing flank elevation wall(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority. 
REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents

Condition : 5 - The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the residential  amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
description: Single and two storey rear extension; conversion of garage to habitable room with installation of window to front; rooflight in side roofslope; external alterations
